newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Alestra says 56 pct LD subscription.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Alestra says 56 pct LD subscription.

text.p: The AT&T-backed Mexican telecommunications company Alestra said on Friday it had been endorsed by 56 percent of presubscription ballots returned to January 21 for long-distance telephone services in the northern city of Monterrey.
Homes and businesses in the city were recently balloted on their preferred long distance carrier now that Telefonos de Mexico's (Telmex) decades old monopoly has come to an end.
Alestra is a joint venture between Mexican conglomerate Alfa, financial group VISA-Bancomer and AT&T.

Alestra cited figures provided by NSCi, the firm conducting the ballot. NSCi figures showed that as of Jan 21, only 18.8 percent of ballot papers had been returned. Users will retain Telefonos de Mexico unless they vote otherwise in the ballot.
